page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: Kineton has a number of cottages, many modernised, from the seventeenth century and larger properties from the nineteenth and early twentieth century which formed the 'old' market town. In the 1930's the council houses of Mill Crescent and King John's Road were built, followed, after World War 2 by those in Park Piece and Dene Close. During the major{council}development of Kineton Farm in 1962, known as St. Peter's Road, Kineton's first flats and old peoples' bungalows appeared. The{private}development by Stubbings on the site of Green Farm followed. The Green Farm End and Shortacres names retain a link with the past, as do Castle Road and Fighting Close. Privately owned houses number about 435 but the number increases as tenants buy their council properties.
